003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.
004 * Permission to use and distribute this software is granted under the BSD 2-Clause 
005 * "Simplified" License (see http://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-2-Clause).

008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.image;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
016import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
017import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
018import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
019import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
020import imagingbook.common.image.access.GridIndexer2D;
021import imagingbook.common.image.access.ImageAccessor;
022
023/**
024 * <p>
025 * This class defines a generic data container for scalar and
026 * vector-valued images, using float-values throughout.
027 * Its primary use is in the {@link GenericFilter} framework.
028 * </p>
029 * <p>
030 * A {@link PixelPack} may represent images with an arbitrary number of
031 * components. Scalar images (such as {@link ByteProcessor}, 
032 * {@link ShortProcessor} and {@link FloatProcessor}) have 1 component,
033 * color images (such as {@link ColorProcessor}) typically have 3 components.
034 * Conversion methods to and from ImageJ's processor classes are provided,
035 * with optional scaling of pixel component values.
036 * </p>
037 * <p>
038 * Internally, pixel data are stored as 1-dimensional {@code float} arrays,
039 * one array for each component.
040 * Method {@link #getData()} may be used to access the internal data directly.
041 * Individual components may be extracted as a {@link PixelSlice} using
042 * method {@link #getSlice(int)}.
043 * </p>
044 * <p>
045 * Methods {@link #getPix(int, int)} and {@link #setPix(int, int, float...)} are
046 * provided to read and write individual pixels, which are 
047 * ALWAYS of type {@code float[]} (even if the underlying image is scalar-valued).
048 * Pixel values returned for positions outside the image boundaries depend 
049 * on the {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy} specified by the constructor
050 * (e.g., {@link #PixelPack(ImageProcessor, double, OutOfBoundsStrategy)}).
051 * </p>
052 * <p>Here is a simple usage example:</p>
053 * <pre>
054 * ColorProcessor ip1 = ... ;   // some color image
055 * PixelPack pack = new PixelPack(ip1);
056 * // process pack:
057 * float[] val = pack.getPix(0, 0);
058 * pack.setPix(0, 0, 128, 19, 255);
059 * ...
060 * ColorProcessor ip2 = pack.toColorProcessor();
061 * </pre>
062 * <p>
063 * A related concept for providing unified access to images is {@link ImageAccessor}.
064 * In contrast to {@link PixelPack}, {@link ImageAccessor} does not duplicate
065 * any data but reads and writes the original {@link ImageProcessor} pixel data
066 * directly.
067 * </p>
068 * 
069 * @author WB
070 * @version 2022/09/03
071 * @see ImageAccessor
072 */
073public class PixelPack {
074        
075        /** The default out-of-bounds strategy (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
076        public static final OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder;
077
078        protected final int width;
079        protected final int height;
080        protected final int depth;
081        protected final float[][] data;
082        protected final int length;
083        private final GridIndexer2D indexer;
084        
085        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
086        
087        /**
088         * Constructor. Creates a blank (zero-valued) pack of pixel data.
089         * @param width the image width
090         * @param height the image height
091         * @param depth the number of channels (slices)
092         * @param obs strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates (pass {@code null} for default)
093         */
094        public PixelPack(int width, int height, int depth, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
095                this.width = width;
096                this.height = height;
097                this.depth = depth;
098                this.length = width * height;
099                this.data = new float[depth][length];
100                this.indexer = GridIndexer2D.create(width, height, obs);
101        }
102        
103        /**
104         * Constructor. Creates a pack of pixel data from the given 
105         * {@link ImageProcessor} object.
106         * Does not scale pixel values and uses
107         * {@link #DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy} as the out-of-bounds strategy
108         * (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}).
109         * @param ip the source image
110         */
111        public PixelPack(ImageProcessor ip) {
112                this(ip, 1.0, DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy);
113        }
114        
115        /**
116         * Constructor. Creates a pack of pixel data from the given 
117         * {@link ImageProcessor} object, using the specified out-of-bounds strategy.
118         * @param ip the source image
119         * @param scale scale factor applied to pixel components
120         * @param obs strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates (pass {@code null} for default)
121         */
122        public PixelPack(ImageProcessor ip, double scale, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
123                this(ip.getWidth(), ip.getHeight(), ip.getNChannels(), obs);
124                copyFromImageProcessor(ip, scale);
125        }
126        
127        /**
128         * Constructor. Creates a new {@link PixelPack} with the same dimension
129         * as the original without copying the contained pixel data
130         * (initialized to zero).
131         * 
132         * @param orig the original {@link PixelPack}
133         */
134        public PixelPack(PixelPack orig) {
135                this(orig, false);
136        }
137        
138        /**
139         * Constructor. Creates a new {@link PixelPack} with the same dimension
140         * as the original.
141         * Optionally the original pixel data are copied, otherwise they are initialized 
142         * to zero values.
143         * 
144         * @param orig the original {@link PixelPack}
145         * @param copyData set true to copy pixel data
146         */
147        public PixelPack(PixelPack orig, boolean copyData) {
148                this(orig.getWidth(), orig.getHeight(), orig.getDepth(), orig.indexer.getOutOfBoundsStrategy());
149                if (copyData) {
150                        orig.copyTo(this);
151                }
152        }
153        
154        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
155        
156        @Deprecated // use getPix(int u, int v, float[] vals)
157        public float[] getVec(int u, int v, float[] vals) {
158                getPix(u, v, vals);
159                return vals;
160        }
161        
162        @Deprecated     // use getPix(int u, int v)
163        public float[] getVec(int u, int v) {
164                return getPix(u, v);
165        }
166        
167        @Deprecated     // use setPix(int u, int v, float ... vals) 
168        public void setVec(int u, int v, float ... vals) {
169                setPix(u, v, vals);
170        }
171        
172        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
173
174        /**
175         * Reads the pixel data at the specified image position.
176         * The supplied array is filled.
177         * The length of this array must match corresponds the number of slices in this
178         * pixel pack.
179         * The values returned for out-of-bounds positions depend on this
180         * pixel-pack's out-of-bounds strategy.
181         * 
182         * @param u the x-position
183         * @param v the y-position
184         * @param vals a suitable array of pixel data
185         */
186        public void getPix(int u, int v, float[] vals) {
187                if (vals == null) 
188                        vals = new float[depth];
189                final int idx = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
190                if (idx < 0) {  // i = -1 --> default value (zero)
191                        Arrays.fill(vals, 0);
192                }
193                else {  
194//                      for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
195//                              vals[k] = data[k][i];
196//                      }
197                        getPix(idx, vals);
198                }
199        }
200        
201        /**
202         * Returns the pixel data at the specified position as a {@code float[]}.
203         * The values returned for out-of-bounds positions depend on this
204         * pixel-pack's out-of-bounds strategy.
205         * 
206         * @param u the x-position
207         * @param v the y-position
208         * @return the array of pixel component values
209         */
210        public float[] getPix(int u, int v) {
211                float[] vals = new float[depth];
212                getPix(u, v, vals);
213                return vals;
214        }
215        
216        /**
217         * Reads the pixel data at the specified 1D index.
218         * The supplied array is filled.
219         * The length of this array must match corresponds the number of slices in this
220         * pixel pack.
221         * The index is not checked, the corresponding pixel must always be inside
222         * the image bounds, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
223         * 
224         * @param idx a valid 1D pixel index (in row-major order)
225         * @param vals a suitable array of pixel data
226         */
227        public void getPix(int idx, float[] vals) {
228                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
229                        vals[k] = data[k][idx];
230                }
231        }
232        
233        /**
234         * Returns the pixel data at the specified position as a {@code float[]}.
235         * The index is not checked, the corresponding pixel must always be inside
236         * the image bounds, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
237         * @param idx a valid 1D pixel index (in row-major order)
238         * @return the array of pixel component values
239         */
240        public float[] getPix(int idx) {
241                float[] vals = new float[depth];
242                getPix(idx, vals);
243                return vals;
244        }
245
246        
247        /**
248         * Sets the pixel data at the specified pixel position.
249         * The length of the value array corresponds to the number of slices 
250         * (components) in this pixel pack.
251         * @param u the x-position
252         * @param v the y-position
253         * @param vals the pixel's component values (may also be a {@code float[]})
254         */
255        public void setPix(int u, int v, float ... vals) {
256                final int idx = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
257                if (idx >= 0) {
258//                      for (int k = 0; k < depth && k < vals.length; k++) {
259//                              data[k][i] = vals[k];
260//                      }
261                        setPix(idx, vals);
262                }
263        }
264        
265        public void setPix(int idx, float ... vals) {
266                for (int k = 0; k < depth && k < vals.length; k++) {
267                        data[k][idx] = vals[k];
268                }
269        }
270        
271        /**
272         * Copies the contents of one pixel pack to another.
273         * The involved pixel packs must have the same dimensions.
274         * @param other another pixel pack
275         */
276        public void copyTo(PixelPack other) {
277                if (!this.isCompatibleTo(other)) {
278                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("pixel packs of incompatible size, cannot copy");
279                }
280                for (int k = 0; k < this.depth; k++) {
281                        System.arraycopy(this.data[k], 0, other.data[k], 0, this.length);
282                }
283        }
284        
285        /**
286         * Checks is this pixel pack has the same dimensions as another
287         * pixel pack, i.e., can be copied to it.
288         * @param other the other pixel pack
289         * @return true if both have the same dimensions
290         */
291        public boolean isCompatibleTo(PixelPack other) {
292                if (this.data.length == other.data.length && this.length == other.length) { // TODO: check width/height too
293                        return true;
294                }
295                else
296                        return false;
297        }
298        
299        /**
300         * Checks is this pixel pack has the same dimensions as the
301         * specified {@link ImageProcessor} instance, i.e., can be copied to it.
302         * @param ip the image processor instance
303         * @return true if compatible
304         */
305        public boolean isCompatibleTo(ImageProcessor ip) {
306                if (this.getWidth() != ip.getWidth() || this.getHeight() != ip.getHeight()) {
307                        return false;
308                }
309                if (this.getDepth() != ip.getNChannels()) {
310                        return false;
311                }
312                return true;
313        }
314        
315        /**
316         * Returns the kth {@link PixelSlice}.
317         * An exception is thrown if the specified slice does not exist.
318         * @param k the slice index (0,...,K-1)
319         * @return the kth {@link PixelSlice}
320         */
321        public PixelSlice getSlice(int k) throws IllegalArgumentException {
322                if (k < 0 || k >= depth) {
323                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("illegal slice number " + k);
324                }
325                return new PixelSlice(k);
326        }
327        
328        /**
329         * Creates and returns a new {@link PixelSlice} with the same dimensions
330         * and out-of-bounds strategy as this {@link PixelPack}.
331         * @return a new pixel slice
332         */
333        public PixelSlice getEmptySlice() {
334                return new PixelSlice();
335        }
336        
337        /**
338         * Returns an array of {@link PixelSlice} instances
339         * for this {@link PixelPack}. All pixel data are shared.
340         * 
341         * @return an array of {@link PixelSlice}
342         */
343        public PixelSlice[] getSlices() {
344                PixelSlice[] slices = new PixelSlice[depth];
345                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
346                        slices[k] = getSlice(k);
347                }
348                return slices;
349        }
350        
351        /**
352         * Returns the {@link FloatProcessor} for the kth pixel slice.
353         * An exception is thrown if the specified slice does not exist.
354         * @param k the slice index (0,...,K-1)
355         * @return the kth {@link FloatProcessor}
356         */
357        public FloatProcessor getFloatProcessor(int k) {
358                return getSlice(k).getFloatProcessor();
359        }
360        
361        
362        /**
363         * Returns an array of {@link FloatProcessor} instances
364         * for this {@link PixelPack}. All pixel data are shared.
365         * 
366         * @return an array of {@link FloatProcessor}
367         */
368        public FloatProcessor[] getFloatProcessors() {
369                FloatProcessor[] processors = new FloatProcessor[depth];
370                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
371                        processors[k] = getFloatProcessor(k);
372                }
373                return processors;
374        }
375        
376        /**
377         * Returns a reference to this {@link PixelPack}'s internal data
378         * array, which is always two-dimensional:
379         * dimension 1 is the slice (component) index,
380         * dimension 2 is the pixel index (each slice is a 1D array).
381         * @return the pixel pack's data array
382         */
383        public float[][] getData() {
384                return data;
385        }
386        
387        /**
388         * Returns the width of the associated image.
389         * @return the image width
390         */
391        public int getWidth() {
392//              return this.indexer.getWidth();
393                return this.width;
394        }
395        
396        /**
397         * Returns the height of the associated image.
398         * @return the image height
399         */
400        public int getHeight() {
401//              return this.indexer.getHeight();
402                return this.height;
403        }
404        
405        /**
406         * Returns the depth (number of slices) of the associated image.
407         * @return the image depth
408         */
409        public int getDepth() {
410                return this.depth;
411        }
412        
413        /**
414         * Returns the out-of-bounds strategy.
415         * @return the out-of-bounds strategy
416         */
417        public OutOfBoundsStrategy getOutOfBoundsStrategy() {
418                return this.indexer.getOutOfBoundsStrategy();
419        }
420
421        /**
422         * Sets all values of this pixel pack to zero.
423         */
424        public void zero() {
425                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
426                        getSlice(k).zero();
427                }
428        }
429        
430        /**
431         * Returns the pixel values in the 3x3 neighborhood around the
432         * specified position.
433         * The returned float-array has the structure {@code [x][y][k]},
434         * with x,y = 0,...,2  and k is the slice index.
435         * 
436         * @param uc the center x-position
437         * @param vc the center x-position
438         * @param nh a float array to be filled in (or null)
439         * @return the neighborhood array
440         */
441        public float[][][] get3x3Neighborhood(int uc, int vc, float[][][] nh) {
442                if (nh == null) 
443                        nh = new float[3][3][depth];
444                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
445                        int u = uc - 1 + i;
446                        for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
447                                int v = vc - 1 + j;
448                                nh[i][j] = getPix(u, v);
449                        }
450                }
451                return nh;
452        }
453        
454//      /**
455//       * Copies the contents of this pixel pack to the supplied {@link ImageProcessor}
456//       * instance, if compatible. Otherwise an exception is thrown.
457//       * 
458//       * @param ip the target image processor
459//       */
460//      public void copyToImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip) {
461//              copyToImageProcessor(this, ip);
462//      }
463        
464        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
465        
466        /**
467         * Inner class representing a single (scalar-valued) component of a 
468         * (vector-valued) {@link PixelPack}.
469         *
470         */
471        public class PixelSlice {
472                private final int idx;
473                private final float[] vals;
474                
475                /**
476                 * Constructor. Creates a pixel slice for the specified component.
477                 * @param idx the slice (component) index
478                 */
479                PixelSlice(int idx) {
480                        this.idx = idx;
481                        this.vals = data[idx];
482                }
483                
484                /** Constructor. Creates an empty (zero-valued) pixel slice with the same
485                 * properties as the containing pixel pack but not associated
486                 * with it.
487                 */
488                PixelSlice() {
489                        this.idx = -1;
490                        this.vals = new float[length];
491                }
492                
493                /**
494                 * Returns the pixel value for the specified image position.
495                 * @param u the x-position
496                 * @param v the y-position
497                 * @return the slice value
498                 */
499                public float getVal(int u, int v) {
500                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
501                        return (i >= 0) ? vals[i] : 0;
502                }
503                
504                /**
505                 * Sets the pixel value at the specified image position.
506                 * @param u the x-position
507                 * @param v the y-position
508                 * @param val the new value
509                 */
510                public void setVal(int u, int v, float val) {
511                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
512                        if (i >= 0) {
513                                vals[i] = val;
514                        }
515                }
516                
517                /**
518                 * Returns the slice index for this pixel slice, i.e, the
519                 * component number in the containing pixel pack.
520                 * -1 is returned if the pixel slice is not associated with
521                 * a pixel pack.
522                 * @return the slice index
523                 */
524                public int getIndex() {
525                        return idx;
526                }
527                
528                /** 
529                 * Returns a reference to the data array associated with this pixel slice.
530                 * @return the data array
531                 */
532                public float[] getArray() {
533                        return vals;
534                }
535                
536                /**
537                 * Returns a {@link FloatProcessor} for this {@link PixelSlice} 
538                 * sharing the internal pixel data (nothing is copied).
539                 * 
540                 * @return a {@link FloatProcessor}
541                 */
542                public FloatProcessor getFloatProcessor() {
543                        return new FloatProcessor(getWidth(), getHeight(), vals);
544                }
545                
546                /**
547                 * Returns the length (number of pixels) of the associated 1D pixel array.
548                 * @return the length of the image array
549                 */
550                public int getLength() {
551                        return vals.length;
552                }
553                
554                /**
555                 * Returns the width of the associated image
556                 * (see also {@link GridIndexer2D}).
557                 * @return the image width
558                 */
559                public int getWidth() {
560                        return PixelPack.this.getWidth();
561                }
562                
563                /**
564                 * Returns the height of the associated image
565                 * (see also {@link GridIndexer2D}).
566                 * @return the image height
567                 */
568                public int getHeight() {
569                        return PixelPack.this.getHeight();
570                }
571                
572                /**
573                 * Sets all pixel values to zero.
574                 */
575                public void zero() {
576                        Arrays.fill(this.vals, 0);
577                }
578                
579                /**
580                 * Copies the contents of this pixel slice to another
581                 * pixel slice.
582                 * @param other the pixel slice to modified
583                 */
584                public void copyTo(PixelSlice other) {
585                        System.arraycopy(this.vals, 0, other.vals, 0, this.vals.length);
586                }
587                
588                /**
589                 * Returns the pixel values from the 3x3 neighborhood centered at
590                 * the specified position.
591                 * The 3x3 array {@code nh[x][y]} has the coordinates
592                 * x = 0,..,2 and y = 0,..,2; 
593                 * the value at position {@code [1][1]} belongs to the 
594                 * specified position.
595                 * If a non-null array is supplied, it is filled and returned.
596                 * If null, a new array is created and returned.
597                 * 
598                 * @param uc the center x-position
599                 * @param vc the center y-position
600                 * @param nh a 3x3 array or null
601                 * @return a 3x3 array of pixel values
602                 */
603                public float[][] get3x3Neighborhood(int uc, int vc, float[][] nh) {
604                        if (nh == null) 
605                                nh = new float[3][3];
606                        for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
607                                int u = uc - 1 + i;
608                                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
609                                        int v = vc - 1 + j;
610                                        nh[i][j] = getVal(u, v);
611                                }
612                        }
613                        return nh;
614                }
615        }
616        
617        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
618
619        /**
620         * Copies the contents of an image processor to an existing
621         * pixel pack, which must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
622         * Does not scale pixel values.
623         * 
624         * @param ip the image processor to be copied
625         */
626        public void copyFromImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip) {
627                copyFromImageProcessor(ip, 1.0);
628        }
629        
630        /**
631         * Copies the contents of an image processor to an existing
632         * pixel pack, which must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
633         * Applies the specified scale factor to the pixel component values.
634         * 
635         * @param ip the image processor to be copied
636         * @param scale scale factor applied to pixel component values
637         */
638        public void copyFromImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip, double scale) {
639                if (!isCompatibleTo(ip) ){
640                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("copyFromImageProcessor(): incompatible ImageProcessor/PixelPack)");
641                }
642                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
643                        copyFromByteProcessor((ByteProcessor)ip, (float) scale);
644                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
645                        copyFromShortProcessor((ShortProcessor)ip, (float) scale);
646                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
647                        copyFromFloatProcessor((FloatProcessor)ip, (float) scale);
648                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor)
649                        copyFromColorProcessor((ColorProcessor)ip, (float) scale);
650                else 
651                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
652        }
653        
654        private void copyFromByteProcessor(ByteProcessor ip, final float scale) {
655                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
656                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
657                        data[0][i] = scale * (0xff & pixels[i]);
658                }
659        }
660        
661        private void copyFromShortProcessor(ShortProcessor ip, final float scale) {
662                short[] pixels = (short[]) ip.getPixels();
663                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
664                        data[0][i] = scale * (0xffff & pixels[i]);
665                }
666        }
667        
668        private void copyFromFloatProcessor(FloatProcessor ip, final float scale) {
669                float[] pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
670//              System.arraycopy(pixels, 0, data[0], 0, pixels.length);
671                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
672                        data[0][i] = scale * pixels[i];
673                }
674        }
675        
676        private void copyFromColorProcessor(ColorProcessor ip, final float scale) {
677                final int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();
678                final int[] rgb = new int[3];
679                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
680                        RgbUtils.decodeIntToRgb(pixels[i], rgb);
681                        data[0][i] = scale * rgb[0];
682                        data[1][i] = scale * rgb[1];
683                        data[2][i] = scale * rgb[2];
684                }
685        }
686        
687        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
688        
689        /**
690         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link ByteProcessor} instance.
691         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 1.
692         * Pixel values are rounded, no scale factor is applied.
693         * 
694         * @return a new {@link ByteProcessor} instance
695         */
696        public ByteProcessor toByteProcessor() {
697                return toByteProcessor(1.0);
698        }
699        
700        /**
701         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link ByteProcessor} instance.
702         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 1.
703         * Applies the specified scale factor to pixel values.
704         * 
705         * @param scale scale factor applied to pixel values (before rounding)
706         * @return a new {@link ByteProcessor} instance
707         */
708        public ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(double scale) {
709                if (depth != 1) {
710                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("cannot convert to ByteProcessor, depth = " + depth);
711                }
712                ByteProcessor ip = new ByteProcessor(width, height);
713                copyToByteProcessor(ip, (float)scale);
714                return ip;
715        }
716        
717        /**
718         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link ShortProcessor} instance.
719         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 1.
720         * Pixel values are rounded, no scale factor is applied.
721         * 
722         * @return a new {@link ShortProcessor} instance
723         */
724        public ShortProcessor toShortProcessor() {
725                return toShortProcessor(1.0);
726        }
727        
728        /**
729         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link ShortProcessor} instance.
730         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 1.
731         * Applies the specified scale factor to pixel values.
732         * 
733         * @param scale scale factor applied to pixel values (before rounding)
734         * @return a new {@link ShortProcessor} instance
735         */
736        public ShortProcessor toShortProcessor(double scale) {
737                if (depth != 1) {
738                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("cannot convert to ShortProcessor, depth = " + depth);
739                }
740                ShortProcessor ip = new ShortProcessor(width, height);
741                copyToShortProcessor(ip, (float)scale);
742                return ip;
743        }
744        
745        /**
746         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance.
747         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 1.
748         * No scale factor is applied to pixel values.
749         * 
750         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
751         */
752        public FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor() {
753                return toFloatProcessor(1.0);
754        }
755        
756        /**
757         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance.
758         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 1.
759         * 
760         * @param scale scale factor applied to pixel values
761         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
762         */
763        public FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(double scale) {
764                if (depth != 1) {
765                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("cannot convert to FloatProcessor, depth = " + depth);
766                }
767                FloatProcessor ip = new FloatProcessor(width, height);
768                copyToFloatProcessor(ip, (float)scale);
769                return ip;
770        }
771        
772        /**
773         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link ColorProcessor} instance.
774         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 3.
775         * Component values are rounded, no scale factor is applied.
776         * 
777         * @return a new {@link ColorProcessor} instance
778         */
779        public ColorProcessor toColorProcessor() {
780                return toColorProcessor(1.0);
781        }
782        
783        /**
784         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link ColorProcessor} instance.
785         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 3.
786         * 
787         * @param scale scale factor applied to component values (before rounding)
788         * @return a new {@link ColorProcessor} instance
789         */
790        public ColorProcessor toColorProcessor(double scale) {
791                if (depth != 3) {
792                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("cannot convert to ColorProcessor, depth = " + depth);
793                }
794                ColorProcessor ip = new ColorProcessor(width, height);
795                copyToColorProcessor(ip, (float)scale);
796                return ip;
797        }
798        
799        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
800        
801        /**
802         * Copies the contents of a pixel pack to an existing
803         * image processor. They must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
804         * Component values are rounded if necessary, no scale factor is applied.
805         * 
806         * @param ip the receiving image processor
807         */
808        public void copyToImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip) {
809                copyToImageProcessor(ip, 1.0);
810        }
811        
812        /**
813         * Copies the contents of a pixel pack to an existing
814         * image processor. They must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
815         * Component values are rounded if necessary, after the
816         * specified scale factor is applied.
817         * 
818         * @param ip the receiving image processor
819         * @param scale  scale factor applied to pixel values
820         */
821        public void copyToImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip, double scale) {
822                if (!this.isCompatibleTo(ip) ){
823                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("copyToImageProcessor(): incompatible ImageProcessor/PixelPack)");
824                }
825                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
826                        copyToByteProcessor((ByteProcessor)ip, (float)scale);
827                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
828                        copyToShortProcessor((ShortProcessor)ip, (float)scale);
829                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
830                        copyToFloatProcessor((FloatProcessor)ip, (float)scale);
831                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor)
832                        copyToColorProcessor((ColorProcessor)ip, (float)scale);
833                else
834                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
835        }
836        
837        private void copyToByteProcessor(ByteProcessor ip, float scale) {
838                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
839                float[] P = this.data[0];
840                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
841                        int val = clipByte(Math.round(scale * P[i]));
842                        pixels[i] = (byte) val;
843                }
844        }
845        
846        private void copyToShortProcessor(ShortProcessor ip, float scale) {
847                short[] pixels = (short[]) ip.getPixels();
848                float[] P = this.data[0];
849                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
850                        int val = clipShort(Math.round(scale * P[i]));
851                        pixels[i] = (short) val;
852                }
853        }
854        
855        private void copyToFloatProcessor(FloatProcessor ip, float scale) {
856                float[] pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
857                float[] P = this.data[0];
858//              System.arraycopy(P, 0, pixels, 0, P.length);
859                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
860                        pixels[i] = scale * P[i];
861                }
862        }
863        
864        private void copyToColorProcessor(ColorProcessor ip, float scale) {
865                int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();
866                float[] R = this.data[0];
867                float[] G = this.data[1];
868                float[] B = this.data[2];
869                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
870                        int r = clipByte(Math.round(scale * R[i]));
871                        int g = clipByte(Math.round(scale * G[i]));
872                        int b = clipByte(Math.round(scale * B[i]));
873                        pixels[i] = RgbUtils.encodeRgbToInt(r, g, b);
874                }
875        }
876        
877        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
878        
879        private int clipByte(int val) {
880                if (val < 0) return 0;
881                if (val > 255) return 255;
882                return val;
883        }
884        
885        private int clipShort(int val) {
886                if (val < 0) return 0;
887                if (val > 65535) return 65535;
888                return val;
889        }
890
891}
